Package sammish93.tbage.tools

Class StringParser

java.lang.Object
sammish93.tbage.tools.StringParser
public class StringParser extends Object
A class intended to parse a string (in the case of this framework, the string that is taken as user input), and determining if it is a valid command, or a valid combination of a verb and a noun. This class cannot be instantiated, and contains only static methods.

  • Method Details

    • read

      public static TreeMap<String,String> read(GameEngine gameEngine, String input) throws InterruptedException
      A method that determines if a string is of valid format to pass as either a single-word command, or a combination of two words (verb as the first word, and noun as the second), before returning it as a TreeMap.
      Parameters:
      gameEngine - Required to communicate with other dependencies such as the game interface.
      input - A string that is to be trimmed and split based on spaces (' '). Example: The string ' hello there ' will be split into two different strings ('hello', and 'there').
      Returns:
      Returns the string as a TreeMap. Each entry is comprised of the type of word ('command, 'verb', or 'noun') as the key, and the word as the value.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException
      See Also:
      • parse(GameEngine, String[])

    • addCommand

      public static void addCommand(String command) throws InvalidValueException
      Adds a command to a static ArrayList containing all recognised commands that are considered valid.
      Parameters:
      command - A string comprised of a single word.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown in an example such as if the string given as a parameter is either empty or is comprised of more than one words.

    • addNoun

      public static void addNoun(String noun) throws InvalidValueException
      Adds a noun to a static ArrayList containing all recognised nouns that are considered valid.
      Parameters:
      noun - A string comprised of a single word.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown in an example such as if the string given as a parameter is either empty or is comprised of more than one words.

    • addVerb

      public static void addVerb(String verb) throws InvalidValueException
      Adds a verb to a static ArrayList containing all recognised verbs that are considered valid.
      Parameters:
      verb - A string comprised of a single word.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown in an example such as if the string given as a parameter is either empty or is comprised of more than one words.

    • removeCommand

      public static void removeCommand(String command) throws InvalidValueException
      Removes a command from a static ArrayList containing all recognised commands that are considered valid. Once removed, this command is no longer considered valid.
      Parameters:
      command - A string comprised of a single word.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown in an example such as if the string given as a parameter is either empty or is comprised of more than one words.

    • removeNoun

      public static void removeNoun(String noun) throws InvalidValueException
      Removes a noun from a static ArrayList containing all recognised nouns that are considered valid. Once removed, this command is no longer considered valid.
      Parameters:
      noun - A string comprised of a single word.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown in an example such as if the string given as a parameter is either empty or is comprised of more than one words.

    • removeVerb

      public static void removeVerb(String verb) throws InvalidValueException
      Removes a verb from a static ArrayList containing all recognised verbs that are considered valid. Once removed, this command is no longer considered valid.
      Parameters:
      verb - A string comprised of a single word.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown in an example such as if the string given as a parameter is either empty or is comprised of more than one words.

    • getVerbs

      public static ArrayList<String> getVerbs()
      Returns:
      Retrieves a static ArrayList containing all verbs considered valid.

    • setVerbs

      public static void setVerbs(ArrayList<String> verbs) throws InvalidValueException
      A method used to set a static ArrayList to a given ArrayList, where all string elements contained within will be considered valid verbs.
      Parameters:
      verbs - An ArrayList where each element is a string comprised of a single word
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown in an example such as if the string given as a parameter is either empty or is comprised of more than one words.

    • getNouns

      public static ArrayList<String> getNouns()
      Returns:
      Retrieves a static ArrayList containing all nouns considered valid.

      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Is thrown in an example such as if the string given as a parameter is either empty or is comprised of more than one words.

    • getCommands

      public static ArrayList<String> getCommands()
      Returns:
      Retrieves a static ArrayList containing all commands considered valid.
